headline: Palantir (PLTR) Net Margins Surge to 28.1%, Reinforcing Bullish Momentum Narrative
summary: Palantir Technologies (PLTR) posted net profit margins of 28.1%, a jump from last year's 18%, and sustained an earnings growth rate of 129.8% over the past year. This is well above the company’s already strong five-year average of 73.2% per year. Momentum is drawing investor attention as margin expansion, high-quality earnings, and forecasts for revenue and earnings growth (26.6% and 29.2% per year, respectively) continue to outpace the broader US market. See our full analysis for Palantir...

This is well above the company’s already strong five-year average of 73.2% per year. Momentum is drawing investor attention as margin expansion, high-quality earnings, and forecasts for revenue and earnings growth (26.6% and 29.2% per year, respectively) continue to outpace the broader US market. headline: Don't panic yet, investors say, as high-flying AI stocks tumble
summary: SINGAPORE (Reuters) -Sharp falls in technology stock prices are cause for caution but not panic yet, say brokers and investors who have been riding a runaway market to record highs and some stretched valuations.  For now, it's the speed and not markets' faith in artificial intelligence that is in question.  "The selloff appears to be largely positioning-driven, with recent outperforming names taking the worst of the move," said Jon Withaar, senior portfolio manager at Pictet Asset Management in Singapore.

content.title: Don't panic yet, investors say, as high-flying AI stocks tumble
content.summary: SINGAPORE (Reuters) -Sharp falls in technology stock prices are cause for caution but not panic yet, say brokers and investors who have been riding a runaway market to record highs and some stretched valuations.  For now, it's the speed and not markets' faith in artificial intelligence that is in question.  "The selloff appears to be largely positioning-driven, with recent outperforming names taking the worst of the move," said Jon Withaar, senior portfolio manager at Pictet Asset Management in Singapore.

headline: Stock Pullback Has Investors Debating How Deep Selloff Will Go
summary: Risk assets slid around the world Tuesday, fanned by a chorus of Wall Street executives who warned about a pullback.  The S&P 500 Index fell 1.2%, its biggest decline since Oct. 10, while a gauge of tech megacaps lost 2.3%.  While there was no single catalyst for the selloff, Palantir Technologies Inc. sank 8% even after boosting its outlook, with its bullish AI prospects failing to offset angst its rally has been excessive.

content.title: Stock Pullback Has Investors Debating How Deep Selloff Will Go
content.summary: Risk assets slid around the world Tuesday, fanned by a chorus of Wall Street executives who warned about a pullback.  The S&P 500 Index fell 1.2%, its biggest decline since Oct. 10, while a gauge of tech megacaps lost 2.3%.  While there was no single catalyst for the selloff, Palantir Technologies Inc. sank 8% even after boosting its outlook, with its bullish AI prospects failing to offset angst its rally has been excessive.

headline: Global Chip Selloff Erases $500 Billion in Value as Fears Mount
summary: Memory makers Samsung Electronics Co. and SK Hynix Inc. dragged South Korea’s benchmark Kospi down as much as 6.2% Wednesday before it pared much of the loss.  Japan’s Advantest Corp. dropped as much as 10% while Asia’s largest stock Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. fell more than 3%.  All are suppliers to Nvidia Corp.

content.title: Global Chip Selloff Erases $500 Billion in Value as Fears Mount
content.summary: Memory makers Samsung Electronics Co. and SK Hynix Inc. dragged South Korea’s benchmark Kospi down as much as 6.2% Wednesday before it pared much of the loss.  Japan’s Advantest Corp. dropped as much as 10% while Asia’s largest stock Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. fell more than 3%.  All are suppliers to Nvidia Corp.

headline: World shares retreat after losses for Big Tech pull US stocks lower
summary: Shares in Europe and Asia retreated Wednesday following a decline on Wall Street spurred by selling of Big Tech shares.  The spillover from Wall Street was evident.  Shares in energy and tech giant SoftBank Group sank 10% on jitters over its investments in artificial intelligence.

content.title: World shares retreat after losses for Big Tech pull US stocks lower
content.summary: Shares in Europe and Asia retreated Wednesday following a decline on Wall Street spurred by selling of Big Tech shares.  The spillover from Wall Street was evident.  Shares in energy and tech giant SoftBank Group sank 10% on jitters over its investments in artificial intelligence.

headline: A Tech Stock Reset Is Underway. Can They Survive Until Nvidia Earnings?
summary: Comments from Wall Street CEOs reflecting concerns over tech valuations, which sit firmly north of their five-year averages, were tied to Tuesday’s selloff, as was a Securities and Exchange Commission filing that unveiled bets against two highflying AI stocks— Palantir  and  Nvidia  —by famed investor Michael Burry.  Tech’s overwhelming dominance of the S&P 500, where the top 10 stocks in the market comprise around 40% of its market value, and crucially a third of its collective earnings, exaggerates the ongoing pullback.  Robert Edwards, chief investment officer at Edwards Asset Management in Naples, Fla., sees the current pullback as “a brief breather” that will be shortly reversed by a combination of “strong earnings and a Federal Reserve in full-on dove mode.”

content.title: A Tech Stock Reset Is Underway. Can They Survive Until Nvidia Earnings?
content.summary: Comments from Wall Street CEOs reflecting concerns over tech valuations, which sit firmly north of their five-year averages, were tied to Tuesday’s selloff, as was a Securities and Exchange Commission filing that unveiled bets against two highflying AI stocks— Palantir  and  Nvidia  —by famed investor Michael Burry.  Tech’s overwhelming dominance of the S&P 500, where the top 10 stocks in the market comprise around 40% of its market value, and crucially a third of its collective earnings, exaggerates the ongoing pullback.  Robert Edwards, chief investment officer at Edwards Asset Management in Naples, Fla., sees the current pullback as “a brief breather” that will be shortly reversed by a combination of “strong earnings and a Federal Reserve in full-on dove mode.”

headline: High Growth Tech Opportunities in the US Market
summary: In the current climate, major U.S. stock indexes have experienced significant declines, with tech-heavy indices like the Nasdaq Composite dropping nearly 2% amid broader market volatility and concerns about high valuations in AI stocks. As investors navigate these turbulent times, identifying high-growth opportunities in the tech sector requires careful consideration of a company's fundamentals and its ability to innovate and adapt within an ever-evolving market landscape.

headline: Norway Suspends Wealth Fund Ethics Rules to Shield Big Tech
summary: The Labor government in Oslo relied on conservative opposition votes to force through the measure, which will allow the fund to retain stakes in companies including Microsoft Corp., Amazon.com Inc. and other tech giants.  Under existing guidelines, their links with Israel’s war in Gaza could have forced the fund to divest.  It’s the first time in the wealth fund’s history that Norway has suspended the work of the ethics council.

content.title: Norway Suspends Wealth Fund Ethics Rules to Shield Big Tech
content.summary: The Labor government in Oslo relied on conservative opposition votes to force through the measure, which will allow the fund to retain stakes in companies including Microsoft Corp., Amazon.com Inc. and other tech giants.  Under existing guidelines, their links with Israel’s war in Gaza could have forced the fund to divest.  It’s the first time in the wealth fund’s history that Norway has suspended the work of the ethics council.

headline: Latest Stock Pullback Shows How Stretched This Market Has Become
summary: Risk assets moderated their slide on Wednesday, following the steepest drops in both the S&P 500 Index and Nasdaq 100 since Oct. 10.  Concerns about an ever-narrowing cohort of stocks driving the gains have become louder, while a hawkish pivot in Federal Reserve commentary has put a dent in optimism about interest-rate cuts.  Technical indicators are increasingly flagging reasons for caution, adding to the drag on sentiment from warnings by Wall Street chief executives about frothy valuations.

content.title: Latest Stock Pullback Shows How Stretched This Market Has Become
content.summary: Risk assets moderated their slide on Wednesday, following the steepest drops in both the S&P 500 Index and Nasdaq 100 since Oct. 10.  Concerns about an ever-narrowing cohort of stocks driving the gains have become louder, while a hawkish pivot in Federal Reserve commentary has put a dent in optimism about interest-rate cuts.  Technical indicators are increasingly flagging reasons for caution, adding to the drag on sentiment from warnings by Wall Street chief executives about frothy valuations.

headline: ‘Casino-Like’ Trump Era Market Powers Robinhood to 450% Gain
summary: Shares of the platform — used to trade stocks, cryptocurrencies and other assets — have soared around 450% since Trump’s win last November through Tuesday’s close, making it the biggest gainer among companies that were worth at least $10 billion ahead of the 2024 election, data compiled by Bloomberg show.  A number of Trump administration policies have helped fuel that surge, including the president’s full-throated support of the cryptocurrency industry and a global trade war that has drawn investors hoping to profit from swings in broader markets.

content.title: ‘Casino-Like’ Trump Era Market Powers Robinhood to 450% Gain

A number of Trump administration policies have helped fuel that surge, including the president’s full-throated support of the cryptocurrency industry and a global trade war that has drawn investors hoping to profit from swings in broader markets.

headline: Palantir Just Got a New Street-High Price Target. Should You Buy PLTR Stock Here?
summary: Palantir soared to a new record-high analyst price target of $230 after its Q3 report showed 63% revenue growth and blockbuster U.S. commercial sales, but the stock trades well above its consensus target and over 450x forward earnings, so expectations are sky-high and volatility is elevated.
